verses.verse: "Come<WH3381> down<WH3381> and sit<WH3427> in the dust,<WH6083> O virgin<WH1330> daughter<WH1323> of Babylon;<WH894> Sit<WH3427> on the ground<WH776> without<WH369> a throne,<WH3678> O daughter<WH1323> of the Chaldeans.<WH3778> For you shall no<WH3808> longer<WH3254> be called<WH7121> tender<WH7390> and delicate.<WH6028>

"Take<WH3947> the millstones<WH7347> and grind<WH2912> meal.<WH7058> Remove<WH1540> your veil,<WH6777> strip<WH2834> off<WH2834> the skirt,<WH7640> Uncover<WH1540> the leg,<WH7785> cross<WH5674> the rivers.<WH5104>
"Your nakedness<WH6172> will be uncovered,<WH1540> Your shame<WH2781> also<WH1571> will be exposed;<WH7200> I will take<WH3947> vengeance<WH5359> and will not spare<WH6293> a man.<WH120>"
Our Redeemer,<WH1350> the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is His name,<WH8034> The Holy<WH6918> One<WH6918> of Israel.<WH3478>

"Sit<WH3427> silently,<WH1748> and go<WH935> into darkness,<WH2822> O daughter<WH1323> of the Chaldeans;<WH3778> For you will no<WH3808> more<WH3254> be called<WH7121> The queen<WH1404> of kingdoms.<WH4467>

"I was angry<WH7107> with My people,<WH5971> I profaned<WH2490> My heritage,<WH5159> And gave<WH5414> them into your hand.<WH3027> You did not show<WH7760> mercy<WH7356> to them, On the aged<WH2205> you made<WH3513> your yoke<WH5923> very<WH3966> heavy.<WH3513>

"Yet you said,<WH559> 'I shall be a queen<WH1404> forever.<WH5703> <WH5769>' These<WH428> things<WH428> you did not consider<WH7760>,<WH5921> <WH3820> Nor<WH3808> remember<WH2142> the outcome<WH319> of them.

"Now,<WH6258> then, hear<WH8085> this,<WH384> you sensual<WH5719> one,<WH5719> Who dwells<WH3427> securely,<WH983> Who says<WH559> in your heart,<WH3824> 'I am, and there<WH657> is no<WH657> one<WH657> besides<WH5750> me. I shall not sit<WH3427> as a widow,<WH490> Nor<WH3808> shall I know<WH3045> loss<WH7908> of children.<WH7908>'

"But these<WH428> two<WH8147> things<WH8147> shall come<WH935> on you suddenly<WH7281> in one<WH259> day:<WH3117> Loss<WH7908> of children<WH7908> and widowhood.<WH489> They shall come<WH935> on you in full<WH8537> measure<WH8537> In spite of your many<WH7230> sorceries,<WH3785> In spite of the great<WH3966> power<WH6109> of your spells.<WH2267>

"And you felt<WH982> secure<WH982> in your wickedness<WH9567> and said,<WH559> 'No<WH369> one<WH369> sees<WH7200> me,' Your wisdom<WH2451> and your knowledge,<WH1847> they have deluded<WH7725> you; For you have said<WH559> in your heart,<WH3820> 'I am, and there<WH657> is no<WH657> one<WH657> besides<WH5750> me.'

"But evil<WH9567> will come<WH935> on you Which you will not know<WH3045> how to charm<WH7837> away;<WH7837> And disaster<WH1943> will fall<WH5307> on you For which you cannot<WH3201> <WH3808> atone,<WH3722> And destruction<WH9585> about which you do not know<WH3045> Will come<WH935> on you suddenly.<WH6597>

"Stand<WH5975> [fast] now<WH4994> in your spells<WH2267> And in your many<WH7230> sorceries<WH3785> With which<WH834> you have labored<WH3021> from your youth;<WH5271> Perhaps<WH194> you will be able<WH3201> to profit,<WH3276> Perhaps<WH194> you may cause<WH6206> trembling.<WH6206>

"You are wearied<WH3811> with your many<WH7230> counsels;<WH6098> Let now<WH4994> the astrologers,<WH1895> <WH8064> Those who prophesy<WH2372> by the stars,<WH3556> Those who predict<WH3045> by the new<WH2320> moons,<WH2320> Stand<WH5975> up and save<WH3467> you from what<WH834> will come<WH935> upon you.

"Behold,<WH2009> they have become<WH1961> like stubble,<WH7179> Fire<WH784> burns<WH8313> them; They cannot<WH3808> deliver<WH5337> themselves<WH5315> from the power<WH3027> of the flame;<WH3852> There<WH369> will be no<WH369> coal<WH1513> to warm<WH2552> by, [Nor] a fire<WH217> to sit<WH3427> before!<WH5048>

"So<WH3651> have those become<WH1961> to you with whom<WH834> you have labored,<WH3021> Who have trafficked<WH5503> with you from your youth;<WH5271> Each<WH376> has wandered<WH8582> in his own way.<WH5676> There<WH369> is none<WH369> to save<WH3467> you.
